result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristian Edgar Picorelli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Full-time work/school (minimum of 40 hours of work per week if in school).

Pay restitution in the amount of $2000 to H.J. 
Court ordered the defendant to pay $500 toward restitution by 11-06-2022

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay the remaining restitution amount, plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges, and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Huber release for work and child care. Report date: 11-07-2022 by 5:00 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristian Edgar Picorelli

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kristian Edgar Picorelli in court.  Attorney Brian Nelson in court for Kristian Edgar Picorelli.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Parties stipulate to restitution amount. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.  
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS with 4 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS/IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED: 
- 45 DAYS condition time in the House of Correction with Huber release for work and child care. Report date: 11-07-2022 by 5:00 pm. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 40 hours of work per week if in school). 
- Pay restitution in the amount of $2000 to H.J. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay $500 toward restitution by 11-06-2022.  Court ordered the defendant to pay the remaining restitution amount, plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges, and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Letter of Support
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Letter of Support.
There needs to be a hearing.

Defendant Kristian Edgar Picorelli in court.  Attorney Brian Nelson in court for Kristian Edgar Picorelli.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kristian Edgar Picorelli in court with Attorney Brian Nelson; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 05cf5472. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Marquette Police Officer B. Larson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Proposed No Contact/No Firearms Order.

Court ordered the $5000.00 cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Kristian Edgar Picorelli in court with attorney Brian Nelson.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
